title: Jennifer Hooker
text: Jennifer Leigh Hooker (born June 6, 1961), also known by her married name Jennifer Brinegar, is an American former competition <a href="swimming%20%28sport%29">swimmer</a> who represented the United States at the <a href="1976%20Summer%20Olympics">1976 Summer Olympics</a> in Montreal, Quebec. She competed in the <a href="Swimming%20at%20the%201976%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%20200%20metre%20freestyle">women's 200-meter freestyle</a>, and finished sixth in the final with a time of 2:04.20. She also swam for the gold medal-winning U.S. team in the preliminary heats of the <a href="Swimming%20at%20the%201976%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%204%20%C3%97%20100%20metre%20freestyle%20relay">women's 4×100-meter freestyle relay</a>, but did not receive a medal. Under the Olympic swimming rules in effect in 1976, only those relay swimmers who competed in the event final were medal-eligible.
